input: DOCTOR: What brings you in today?\nPATIENT: Well, I guess I’ve been falling a lot more than before, and my legs feel really heavy and strange sometimes. My skin on my hands and feet has been getting really dry and rough, and I don’t know why. It’s all kind of confusing and makes me worried.
output:
THINKING: The patient reports increased falling, heavy and strange sensations in the legs, and changes in skin quality on the hands and feet. These are new details added to the previous summary.

ANSWER: The patient is experiencing increased falls, heaviness and unusual sensations in the legs, and dry, rough skin on the hands and feet.

input:
DOCTOR: What brings you in today?
PATIENT: Well, I guess I’ve been falling a lot more than before, and my legs feel really heavy and strange sometimes. My skin on my hands and feet has been getting really dry and rough, and I don’t know why. It’s all kind of confusing and makes me worried.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about how these symptoms have been affecting your daily life, and if you've noticed any other changes or concerns you'd like to share?
PATIENT: It’s been really hard, I guess. I fall a lot and can’t walk straight sometimes, and my skin feels really dry and itchy all the time. I’ve been worried because I feel different from other kids and I get tired easily.
output:
THINKING: The latest conversation confirms additional details about the impact of symptoms on daily life, including difficulty walking straight, feeling different from peers, and getting tired easily. However, no new objective clinical findings or diagnostic details are introduced. The summary is updated with this information.

ANSWER: The patient reports increased falls, heaviness and strange sensations in the legs, dry and itchy skin on the hands and feet, difficulty walking straight, feeling different from other kids, and getting tired easily.

input:
DOCTOR: What brings you in today?
PATIENT: Well, I guess I’ve been falling a lot more than before, and my legs feel really heavy and strange sometimes. My skin on my hands and feet has been getting really dry and rough, and I don’t know why. It’s all kind of confusing and makes me worried.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me more about how these symptoms have been affecting your daily life, and if you've noticed any other changes or concerns you'd like to share?
PATIENT: It’s been really hard, I guess. I fall a lot and can’t walk straight sometimes, and my skin feels really dry and itchy all the time. I’ve been worried because I feel different from other kids and I get tired easily.
DOCTOR: Can you tell me how these symptoms started and how they have changed over time, and whether there are any activities or situations that seem to make them better or worse?
PATIENT: Well, it kinda started when he was little, and he just wasn’t walking right like other kids. Now, he falls a lot and feels wobbly even just standing. Sometimes, when he’s running or playing, he gets maybe more tired or shaky. I don’t know if there's anything that makes it better, but he seems sad or frustrated sometimes, especially when he can’t do what other children can.
output:
THINKING: The conversation reinforced previously mentioned symptoms and their impact, including falling more frequently, feeling wobbly while standing, dry and itchy skin on the hands and feet, and feeling different from peers with easy fatigue. No new clinical findings or findings from physical examination are provided.  
ANSWER: The patient is a child who has been experiencing increased falls and a sensation of heaviness and strange feelings in the legs. The child's skin on the hands and feet has become very dry and rough, with persistent dryness and itchiness. He has difficulty walking straight and feels wobbly even when standing. He feels different from other children and gets tired easily. The symptoms started in early childhood. The child sometimes feels sad or frustrated when unable to do what other children can.
